dct_title_s: A New and Correct Map | of the | WORLD | from the latest | Observati- | ons
dct_description_sm: Purchased as a book with two maps in it.

California as an island with two deeply indented northern bays, and labeled “California.”  America slopes sharply to the east at about the 43rd parallel with the S. of Anian lightly engraved.“front. Page 42” (upper right).An advertisement for Senex’s globes is between the hemispheres at the bottom of the page.Issued in: Geography Anatomiz’d ... The nineteenth edition ... / By Pat. Gordon. -- London : Printed for J. and P. Knapton and others, [1749].  Possibly issued in earlier editions.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
